intro: Xanthorhiza simplicissima, commonly known as golden rhizoma, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange roots, which contain a variety of chemical compounds. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has palmately lobed leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in late spring, followed by red berries that are edible for some wildlife. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
